text:
Anyone here has worked with GeoJSON.jl package?
The basic usage on the docs isnt working for me
<https://juliageo.org/GeoJSON.jl/stable/#GeoJSON.jl-1>

`using GeoJSON`
`osm_buildings = """`
`{`
    `"type": "FeatureCollection",`
    `"features": [{`
        `"type": "Feature",`
        `"geometry": {`
            `"type": "Polygon",`
            `"coordinates": [`
                `[`
                    `[13.42634, 52.49533],`
                    `[13.42630, 52.49529],`
                    `[13.42640, 52.49525],`
                    `[13.42611, 52.49494],`
                    `[13.42590, 52.49501],`
                    `[13.42583, 52.49495],`
                    `[13.42619, 52.49483],`
                    `[13.42660, 52.49524],`
                    `[13.42634, 52.49533]`
                `]`
            `]`
        `},`
        `"properties": {`
            `"color": "rgb(255,200,150)",`
            `"height": 150`
        `}`
    `}]`
`}"""`
`buildings = GeoJSON.read(osm_buildings)`

I am getting error as
`ERROR: SystemError: opening file "{\n    \"type\": \"FeatureCollection\",\n    \"features\": [{\n        \"type\": \"Feature\",\n        \"geometry\": {\n            \"type\": \"Polygon\",\n            \"coordinates\": [\n                [\n                    [13.42634, 52.49533],\n                    [13.42630, 52.49529],\n                    [13.42640, 52.49525],\n                    [13.42611, 52.49494],\n                    [13.42590, 52.49501],\n                    [13.42583, 52.49495],\n                    [13.42619, 52.49483],\n                                        [13.42660, 52.49524],\n                    [13.42634, 52.49533]\n                ]\n            ]\n        },\n        \"properties\": {\n            \"color\": \"rgb(255,200,150)\",\n            \"height\": 150\n        }\n    }]\n}": File name too long`

Anyone here has worked with GeoJSON.jl package?

text: The example works for me. Are you using the exact same code as the example? Note that `GeoJSON.read` is different than `read` defined in Base. `GeoJSON.read` expects a GeoJSON string or IOStream. So if you want to read from a file, you need to open or read that file first, like this example from the docs: Use GeoJSON.read(read("tech_square.geojson")) to read GeoJSON files from disk.

text: So what are other packages useful for distance computation? Simple point to line/poly distance, centroid and other stuff ?

elements.text: So what are other packages useful for distance computation? Simple point to line/poly distance, centroid and other stuff ?

text: Hmm for pure julia I'm not aware of much else, but you can use <https://github.com/yeesian/ArchGDAL.jl> for this. Or <https://github.com/evetion/GeoDataFrames.jl>, which builds on top of that for tabular data.
